author: Chinua Achebe
title: Things Fall Apart
description: A compelling novel that explores the life of Okonkwo, a respected warrior in an African village, and the effects of colonialism on his community.

author: Hans Christian Andersen
title: Fairy tales
description: A timeless collection of enchanting fairy tales that have captured the imaginations of readers for generations.

author: Dante Alighieri
title: The Divine Comedy
description: A monumental epic poem that takes the reader on a journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven, exploring themes of sin, redemption, and divine love.

author: Unknown
title: The Epic Of Gilgamesh
description: One of the oldest surviving works of literature, this epic follows the adventures of the hero Gilgamesh as he seeks immortality and confronts themes of friendship, mortality, and the power of gods.

author: Unknown
title: The Book Of Job
description: An ancient text exploring the nature of suffering and the relationship between humans and God.

author: Unknown
title: One Thousand and One Nights
description: A collection of Middle Eastern folk tales, including famous stories like Aladdin and Ali Baba.

author: Unknown
title: Njáls Saga
description: An Icelandic saga set in the 10th and 11th centuries, depicting the conflicts and feuds of the early Norse settlers.

author: Jane Austen
title: Pride and Prejudice
description: A witty and charming novel that follows the romantic entanglements of the Bennet sisters as they navigate societal expectations and the search for love.

author: Honoré de Balzac
title: Le Père Goriot
description: A poignant novel that delves into the complexities of human relationships, focusing on themes of greed, social climbing, and parental love.

author: Samuel Beckett
title: Waiting for Godot
description: A play that follows two characters, Vladimir and Estragon, as they wait for the arrival of someone named Godot, contemplating life, existence, and the nature of time.
